We are #MiamiTech

Join us in building an equitable, collaborative, diverse and thriving community for makers, technologists, and advocates in the 305.

Take the Pledge

Resources to help you live our values

Our goals are ambitious, and we have a lot more work to do to help #MiamiTech achieve them. Now that you’ve taken the pledge, here are some organizations and resources that can help us build toward a brighter future together.

Stay engaged and collaborate

Refresh Miami

Venture Cafe Miami hosts Miami’s largest weekly tech event — the Thursday Gathering. The Thursday Gathering and Venture Cafe’s Slack are great spaces to meet the community and get involved.

Startup.miami

Beacon Council

Knight Foundation

Invest and fundraise in Miami

Miami Angels

Learn and adopt diversity and inclusion best practices

The Florida Diversity Council is our state’s chapter of the National Diversity Council, which aims to to advance diversity and inclusion by transforming our work places and communities into inclusive environments where individuals are valued for their talents and empowered to reach their fullest potential. The NDC and its local chapters host events and offer resources, publications, toolkits, certifications, and trainings for companies and leaders.

Mozilla has developed a number of useful resources around Codes of Conduct and enforcement, diversity data and metrics standards, training and research to improve diversity and inclusion in open-source communities. Many of these tools and templates may be applied to your organization or company.

Create and enforce a Code of Conduct

Miami Foundation

Learn from other communities

TechEquity Collaborative is spearheading efforts to help tech make local Bay-Area communities more equitable. This talk from founder Catherine Bracy lays out some of the principles of how the rise of the creative class has shocked cities and how tech can help reduce inequality.

This site is managed and maintained by an organizing committee of local tech leaders with ♥ for Miami.

We would love your help improving this site and strengthening our community and our mission.

Learn more and contribute on Github.
